questions.question_text:
You need to ensure that the support technicians can meet the technical requirement for the Montreal office mobile devices.
What is the minimum of dedicated support technicians required?
questions.answer_description:
Contoso identifies the following technical requirements:
✑ Dedicated support technicians must enroll all the Montreal office mobile devices in Endpoint Manager.
✑ Each dedicated support technician must be assigned only a single Device Enrollment Manager (DEM) account.
You can enroll up to 1,000 mobile devices with a single Azure Active Directory account by using a device enrollment manager (DEM) account. We have 3,100 devices; hence we will need 4 DEMs at a minimum.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/enrollment/device-enrollment-manager-enroll https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sccm/mdm/deploy-use/enroll-devices-with-device-enrollment-manager

discussion.content: 1000 enrolles per DEM account

Selected Answer: C
so many word for a basic multiple choice question.

questions.question_text:
You need to create the Microsoft Store for Business.
Which user can create the store?

discussion.content: To be clear, the "Intune requirements" referenced in the question refer to this section of the case study: "When a Windows 10 device is joined to Azure AD, the device must enroll to Endpoint Manager automatically."

comments.content: And the answer provided is correct.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Shouldn''t we turn on the policy?

comments.content: Yes, the second should ”Enable the policy’
My thought as well, like if it is off it doesn't matter what settings we change.

discussion.content:
1usuarios e grupos 
2 grant
So now? Groups and?

comments.content: Point n6, so groups and grant-> device compliant https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/create-conditional-access-intune#create-the-conditional-access-policy

discussion.content:
Step1:Select the Group1 under users.
Step2: Exclude the compliant devices under Conditions>Filter for devcies (because the policy will block unless excluded)
Step 3:
Then Turn on the Policy.
For the second - I thought it was - Access Controls - Grant - Grant access - Require device to be marked as compliant

The answer seems to be correct. 
With the following settings
 1) Users and groups > select 'Group1'
 2) Conditons > Device state > Exclude > select 'Device marked as compliant'
Group1 cannot access EXO from non-compliant devices.
This means that Group1 users will only have access to EXO from compliant device.
Require device to be marked as compliant - is now under GRANT field of the Conditional Access policy. So NOT under "Condition" -> "Device state"

comments.content: So now we choose users and groups under assignments then grant/block access under access control.

discussion.content: users and group + require device to be compliant
Still valid. Question featured in exam 22.8.2022
This question is quite a cheeky one, if your not in the US you may not know when fall and spring are. It should be changed to months

The answer seems to be correct.

1) September* feature updates : Serviced for 30 months from release date
--> It is valid for 30 months from September last year, but now 6 months have passed, so 24 months remaining

2) March* feature updates : Serviced for 18 months from release date
--> Valid from March this year until 18 months later

comments.content:
Ignore the 1st sentence, forgot that the question specifies: "How much time as of March"

In that case the answer is correct

discussion.content:
Not sure how long ago this changed but answer is not correct anymore

From Microsoft:

"Servicing timeline released first half of year (H1) for Windows 10 Enterprise: 18 months"
"Servicing timeline released second half of year (H2) for Windows 10 Enterprise: 36 months"

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/faq/windows#windows-10

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
As of March, how long will the computers in each office remain supported by Microsoft? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Contoso plans to implement the following changes:
✑ Update computers in Seattle and Montreal with the fall Semi-Annual Channel feature update.
✑ Update computers in the New York office with the spring Semi-Annual Channel feature update.

Box 1: 24 months -
September Feature Updates (fall Semi-Annual Channel feature updates) are serviced for 30 months from release date but by March, 6 of those 30 months have lapsed; hence, 24 months remains

Box 2: 18 months -
March Feature Updates (spring Semi-Annual Channel feature updates) are serviced for 18 months from release date
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/announcements/windows-10-servicing-support-updates
